class_notes: Climate change policy takes place at every scale: local, regional, national, and global. Climate change policy also involves not just science, mitigation and adaptation but also climate justice and environmental law. This course focuses on understanding the sources and trends of greenhouse gas emissions, various stakeholders involved and covers a range of public policy areas related to climate change, including energy, food and agriculture, transportation, and education. In this course, students will learn about the complexity involved in climate policymaking and how to conduct climate policy analysis.
course_description: A course designed for second year students on topics of interest in environmental sciences. This course may count as elective credit for the ENVS major and minor; relevant topics may count towards the ENVS Sustainability Sciences or Earth and Atmospheric Sciences minors. See current course atlas.
